title: Journal of a tour through the Highlands of Scotland during the summer of MDCCCXXIX.
author: Botfield, Beriah
snippet: The oldspire 120 feet high still remains, very perfect, andfrom its top commands a fine view of the vale of theEsk, in the direction of Melgund Castle, and of Ab-erlemno, northward of the Grampians, and eastward of the town, basin, bridge, and harbour ofMontrose, and the intervening course of the southEsk to the sea ; whUe directly beneath lie the townof Brechin and its castle, situated on a precipiceoverhanging the river, and embosomed in tuftedtrees.
